Cicero's own knowledge of Greek oratory in books is amply documented by the Orator.
title: Cato the Censor

Cato kept written copies of his speeches and published texts of at least two in the Origines; Cicero claims to have read more than 150 (Brut. 65), though it is not clear whether these were published by Cato or posthumously. On the publication of speeches in classical Greece, see Luciano Canfora, ``L'AgoraÁ: il discorso suasorio,''
